title: What kind of music are you into? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m more eclectic when it comes to music. I grew up with my mom as a music teacher (she was strict as to what type of music should I listen especially while studying - Classical.  And she was the one who made me appreciate and love Philippine tribal music and Asian music). When I was in high school (early 2000s), my classmates were into rock, punk, alternative, etc.   So I had to divide myself (haha) to be in both worlds: appreciating the old school and the musical trend that time. Then in college, I was more into reggae and old school rock and roll. Or rock bands from 80s backwards.    But during the nights, I was into the OPM (Original Pilipino Music). Sample of OPM (English language): Journey by Lea Salonga This was very popular as a graduation song back then hehehe.  OPM (Tagalog language): Himig ng Pag-ibig by Asin (lit. translation Melody of Love by Salt haha)  I like folk and country hits too (international and local). Oh! and Tunog Kalye (OPM street music) especially from the ‘90s never gets old. Sample of Tunog Kalye from the ‘90s: (it can be in English or Tagalog or both) 214 by Rivermaya (English song)  With a Smile by Eraserheads (English song)  Esem by Yano (Tagalog Song)  Don’t Touch my Birdy by Parokya ni Edgar (Tagalog-English)  In 2011 or so, my female co-worker introduced me to Mr. Bones and The Boneyard Circus   I also support the Visayan pop music (which showcase the talents from Visayas and Mindanao and using the Bisaya language - - not Tagalog). Sample of Tagalog Pop: Dahil Sayo by Inigo Pascual  And sample of VisPop (Visayan particularly Cebuano language): Balay ni Mayang (Written by Kyle Wong and Marianne DungogPerformed by Martina Sandiego and Kyle Wong)  I also listen to gospel music (from the hymns up to the Christian rock to the Christian reggae). Oh, the Gregorian chants (and other Orthodoxy chants) give me thrills from time to time. Come Thou Fount of Every Blessing - Covered by Sarah Noëlle  Gregorian chant - Deum verum  Russian orthodox angelic song  But as of the moment (thanks to my anxiety haha), I listen to Ancient Chinese music - - it’s more relaxing. It’s a sort of a lullaby so I can sleep peacefully. Beautiful Chinese Music - Bamboo Flute  Hahaha, I just realized that I’m not yet half-way through…but anyway…as long as I am in a mood then I don’t shy away from exploring different genre (even if I don’t understand the lyrics, language and even if they belong to the oldest school such as this one…)

I’m a jazz singer, so jazz is my go-to music. Since jazz incorporates music from many genres, I listen to a wide variety. My music listening began in the 1950s, so jazz, Broadway, doo-wop, RnB, Beatles, Hollywood musicals and theme songs, blues, Motown/Stax, rock, funk, some classical, Brazilian, Arabic, Stevie Wonder, Aretha Franklin, James Brown and Ray Charles. I have over 17,000 songs in my listening catalog, and I’m about a third of the way through my recordings ( and I’m not counting my performances). I’ll just say I’m into music…

I mostly listen to metal and rap. I'm not one of those people who “listens to everything” because that'd be a bold faced lie. My favorite genre of all time though is nu metal and I know I'll get shit for that lmao. It's just something about the rawness and aggression that can't be matched to me. I also like other forms of metal, rock, EDM, and reggae, but nu metal is just the tits. I usually don't listen to my music around other people because I get judged and made fun of for it. 1. Because they think it sounds horrible and 2. Because I'm black and “black people don't listen to that bullshit”, so I just say fuck it and not listen to it at all around my friends and family because I don't feel like hearing their mouths

I listen to a lot of classical music on the radio and I attend the opera. But my music collection also includes: jazz, smooth jazz40s big band swingclassic rockbluesbroadway and filmalternative rockcontemporary rockcountry and westernbluegrassnew ageethnic folk music (Moravian, Bulgarian, Russian, Caribbean steel drums, etc.)exoticaCelticHawaiianWorld music (Pink Martini, etc.)misc weird stuff

Hip hop Rap Underground hiphop Underground rap Metal Punk Death metal Classic rock Boybands Acapella Classical Stomp Opera German pop Chinese pop American pop Pre-1995 Country Rap-core Orchestra Symphony Ballet Instrumental …..

God Knows I Tried - - Lana Del Rey  King - - Lauren Aquilina  Jenny of Oldstones - - Florence Welch | Game of Thrones  SummerTime Sadness - - Lana Del Rey  Drive Home - - Steven Wilson  Affection - - Cigarettes After Sex  Everglow - -Coldplay  Song for Zula - - Phosphorescent
Canadian pop,Alec Benjamin, country, and the occasional American pop
